segments.text: For the strings, each string is of length m. So I'll need to read n strings, each of m characters (plus null terminator). So declare a 2D array like char arrs[n][m+1]. segments.text: Wait, strchr returns a pointer, so subtracting the start of the string gives the index. So for each string in arrs, loop through each character until 'G' is found, note the index. Then, collect all unique lengths. In Java, a HashSet is used. In C, since there's no built-in HashSet, I need to implement this. segments.text: For example, create an array of size m+1 (since the maximum possible difference is m-1, if S is last and G is first). Initialize all to false. Then for each length, mark the index as true. Finally, count the number of true entries.
